ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed grammar and vocabulary knowledge of Modern Standard Arabic. I also got more comfortable speaking and my writing improved significantly.
I definitely improved my arabic ability especially in reading and writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I would have liked to speak in class in Arabic more often. I also enjoy the writing assignments and would like those to be more frequent. I think the grammar content and lessons could have been taught in a more organized way. Feedback also could have been a little bit more clear. The strengths of this class were that it was small, and I felt like I could always ask questions. I also enjoyed the vocabulary quizes and using Al-Kitaab.

A strength is that the course encourages you to practice arabic every day, and a weakness is that the course lacked speaking practice, so that even though I think my understanding of the arabic language improved my speaking is still elementary.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to learn Arabic I would definitely recommend this course! I enjoyed learning from Professor Aziz. Arabic is such a beautiful language and brought a lot to my life this semester. So yesI would recommend.
I would recommend this course, but I would encourage the student to reach out to the professor and go to office hours because otherwise the material may be confusing.
